message_1: Let X be a projective curve of genus g over the field of complex numbers with a line bundle L of degree d on it. If h⁰(X, L) = n and h¹(X, L) = m, then what is the value of the Euler characteristic χ(X, L)?
message_2:
The Euler characteristic χ(X, L) of a line bundle L on a projective curve X is defined as the alternating sum of the dimensions of the cohomology groups:

χ(X, L) = h⁰(X, L) - h¹(X, L)

Given that h⁰(X, L) = n and h¹(X, L) = m, we can substitute these values into the formula:

χ(X, L) = n - m

Therefore, the Euler characteristic χ(X, L) is equal to n - m.
